name: Thomas the Angry Tank Engine (Barb 28/ F 4/ CoT 8)
author: Stagmeister

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Hello All,

This one is very much in the development stage. I'm trying to construct a mundane party tank who's a little, shall we say, on the volatile side. I've given him both Terrifying and Mighty Rage, as well as EDRIII and a deep HP pool to help with his less than spectacular AC (which you'd think is a big no-no for a tank). All of this comes at a price, however, so he ain't the strongest in the world. Raging helps, obviously, but I'd welcome your thoughts - including, but hopefully not limited to, "it's a stupid idea, stop it now".

Apologies/ excuses out of the way, do please have a look where I'm currently at...

Oh, and I haven't factored in the dwarfly stuff yet, sorry.

Barbarian 28/ Fighter 4/ CoT 8
Any non-Lawful, non-Evil

If you like, you can swap out LoH (for -1 to all saves) for Exotic Weapons Prof and grab some Dwarven Waraxe - it really rather depends on whether they're readily available where you play. I could bang on about the pointy-eared devils getting swords and bows for free while our bearded heroes don't even get proficiency in their own special weapon, but I won't. Yet.

Cheers

EDIT: Miscalculated DR - I'd only given 2 to each EDR feat rather than 3, so it's 15/-, not 12/-. Have changed it. I've also taken Orion's suggestion about the starting stats on board and adjusted the skill-set accordingly. Now I've just got to factor in the dwarf stuff and take the EDR feats earlier, which I'll do soon.

EDIT 2: Done the other stuff now.

EDIT 3: And some more, thanks to Orion's additional suggestions. I've also swapped the feats I take the Skill Foci and their epic equivalents around. And I had another thought as well - taking Mighty Rage at Barb 24 (L34) and dropping Epic Prowess down to level 40 as the Barb bonus feat there, while shuffling CoT 8 up to level 36 and taking AS as the bonus feat there. And I must confess I'm now tempted to drop down to 26 levels of Barb and lift it to 10 of CoT. No loss of bonus feat, and +1 to all saves, at the expense of 4 hit points. Hmm.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Looks interesting Stag, I have yet to play a terrifying rage build yet, and I might take this for a spin one day.

I am curious about the starting Dex 13 and Int 13. Would it be better to go Dex 12 Int 14 or am I missing something. Or because you take fighter at lvl 2, with heavy armor proficency even set Dex to 8 and Int to 16 for heaps of skill points. Or put Cha to 10 and consider swapping the pre epic skill foci feats for toughness and iron will

With EDR III it's a powerful ability and I would take those feats much earlier early epic. I noted you take Str 19 at level 12, you could change this to Cons +1 allowing you to take EDR I, II and II at levels 21, 22 and 24.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
All good suggestions, Orion, thank you! This is exactly why I brought it here now - to counteract my natural inclinations. As for the Dex/ Int thing, that's just me being a nidiot. I knew I needed 13 Int for IKD so simply set it in stone and didn't even look at adjusting it. A 12 Dex/ 14 Int is a much better idea. Those extra 43 skill points will be very useful. I've never liked dropping Dex to 8 (or even 10) because even full plate allows for +1 Dex to AC, and AC is pretty sparse here so I want every drop I can squeeze out of it. I know it isn't min/maxing optimally, but still...

As far as EDR goes, you're right as well. I think I just got twitchy about my AB and damage output. I'll see what I can do. (I'd have loved to take Barb and DwD, but rules is rules I suppose, damn it.)

And as for Raging in its many forms, (and apparently it's particularly effective on WoG, btw), Greater Rage (Barb15) gives +6 to Str and Con, +3 to Will saves, and -2 to AC, and lasts for Con modifier +9 rounds. Its Terrifying variety lasts 1xd3 rounds and has a DC of Intimidate +1xd10, as well as paralyzing its targets, so all but your sternest pally should be cacking his pants. Mighty Rage is only useable 3 times a day (you can use Mighty and then Greater, but not the other way around), has no AC penalty, lasts for your Con modifier +11 rounds, and grants +8 to both Str and Con, and +4 to Will saves. You do need 21 Str and 21 Con before you can take it, however. I'd love to take it earlier than 40, but I'm doing a weird balancing act, so...

I will incorporate your suggestions in an edit, should anyone else contribute. Cheers!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
I have a Rager on WoG.

Don't count on the Str increase to help all that much - it just does not last long enough!

Mine is based on the Undead Terror build (Barb/Bard/PM)

The Terrifying is great tho - only annoying thing is chasing the buggers down!  By the time you have killed 2~3, it has worn off because they all run willy-nilly in all directions!  If you can get them all clogged up at a choke point, it's like shooting ducks in a barrel!

Too bad one cannot get a feat to increase the number of rages aka extra turning for clerics and pallys.

I do like the EDR III however!  Sweet!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Quite right, Web. The first thing that irked me with Barbs was hunting victims of Rage down after they've run away - potentially not just time-consuming, but very dangerous to boot. But now, in most arenas (WoG clearly being an exception), Rage freezes foes to the spot, which is much handier.

And I believe we discussed increasing the number of Rages in my Terrifying Bane thread recently. So we're on the same song-sheet there.

As to the benefits to Strength, here we've got 8x15 rounds (120) per day of Greater Rage (+6 Str) and 3x17 rounds (51) of Mighty Rage (+8 Str). That's not so bad, is it?

Barbarian just seems to be an under-utilized class, so I simply wanted to take it out and show it the sights, give it an ice cream, take in a show and so on. And while tanking with one might seem a little perverse, I think we can get it working. I'm more than happy to learn from those who've been around the block once or twice, though.

Thanks for the insight!

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
Oh, the buff itself is good, it just doesn't last all that long.  And I feel there are too few of them to boot!

I do like my Undead Terror.

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content: I don't know if it's changed in enhanced edition or on the server(s) where you play, but in 1.69 vanilla the aura of terrifying rage applies to both greater rage and mighty rage.  Moreover if you have both mighty and greater rage active at a time, you will have two auras active, so everyone has to roll twice against the effect. You can do this by activating mighty rage first, and greater rage after, this way all the effects will stack. Also while the roll is against fear, the effect is actually a paralysis effect, so no one will flee from you.
